channel.title: Categories on Alexandru Pisarenco
channel.description: Recent content in Categories on Alexandru Pisarenco

item.title: Making github pages with hugo
item.description: I saw the github pages of Conor Lamb and he had a nice guide there highlighting the “easy” steps in setting up a “modern”, “not outdated” type of “blog”. Jokes aside, there’s a reason why I decided to do it as well. Thanks Conor Lamb for the guide. It kinda helped! üëç What’s Hugo? Hugo is a static website generator that takes a theme, a list of markdown files, and some config and static content and makes it kiss and make a baby which is this site you’re reading now.

item.title: Hi! I'm Alex.
item.description: Welcome to my attempt at documenting what I do and why I do it. A bit about me I’m a technical person who sometimes gets very opinionated on subjects that I’ve spent a lot of time getting into. I learn a lot every month of my life, and in order to see that I was wrong at some stuff, I need a blog. My day job is a software engineer, which is a fancy way of saying that I’m good at telling computers what to do really well and quite fast.
